description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability associated with the Windows layer-2 bridge network driver (CVE-2024-38053), ensure that relevant security updates are installed:

1. Identify the Windows build version currently running on your system.
2. Download and install the appropriate update from the Microsoft Update Catalog for your respective Windows version and architecture:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - Include the corresponding updates for other Windows versions as applicable.
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
This fix addresses the use after free vulnerability in the Windows layer-2 bridge network driver, which could lead to remote code execution.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a supported version of Windows as per the listed build numbers.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation of updates.
